summary: Spawn invisible book shelves when, where and as many as you like.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ff7700][size=5][u][b]Spawnable Book Shelf (aka SBS)[/b][/u][/size][/color]

[color=#ff7700][u][size=4]Description:[/size][/u][/color]
Spawn invisible book shelves where, when and as many as you like.
Move or Delete them anytime you like.
These book shelves come in 2 sizes.

Spawnable Book Shelf 11 fits nicely on most narrow Noble Shelves and can hold:
[spoiler]11 Books
or
14 Ingots
or
18 Scrolls
or
7 Potions
or
3 Claws
or
3 Paragon Eggs
or
2 Insect Jars[/spoiler]Spawnable Book Shelf 18 fit nicely on Common, Upper, Orc shelves and can hold:
[spoiler]18 Books
or
30 Ingots
or
33 Scrolls
or
11 Potions
or
5 Claws
or
5 Paragon Eggs
or
4 Insect Jars[/spoiler]These invisible spawnable book shelves can be placed on shelves, tables, the ground, float in the air or anywhere you see fit.
Basically where you position the shelf marker is where the shelf will sit.
[color=#ff7700][u][size=4]
Requirements:[/size][/u][/color]
SKSE 1.7.3
SkyUI

[color=#ff7700][u][size=4]Update Changes 0.3:[/size][/u][/color]
Added Claw support
Added Paragon Portal Key Support (if you have Dawngard)
Added Insect Jar Support

[color=#ff7700][u][size=4]Clean SBS Install:[/size][/u][/color]
1. Extract contents to your \Data\ directory
2. Enable SBS.esp in your load order.
3. Play game and enjoy.

[color=#ff7700][size=4][u]Updating from prior SBS version::[/u][/size][/color]
Not doing the update steps below may result in new features not working or other problems.
1. Before updating load your game and use the Remove All Book Shelves option in SBS MCM menu.
2. After Remove all has completed do a game save and exit game.
3. Drop SBS from your load order.
5. Load your game save and do a game save and exit game.
6. Extract contents of updated version to your \Data\ directory and yes to overwrite when prompted.
7. Enable SBS.esp in your load order.
8. Play game and enjoy.

[color=#ff7700][size=4][u]Archive Contents:[/u][/size][/color]
SBS.bsa
SBS.esp

[color=#ff7700][size=4][u]Brief how to use in game:[/u][/size][/color]
[spoiler]You will see 2 new items added to your Inventory under the Misc tab:
Spawnable Book Shelf 11
Spawnable Book Shelf 18

Dorp one of the Spawnable Book Shelf misc items from your inventory and your inventory will close and you'll see a book self marker in front of you at your feet.
(The Spawnable Book Shelf misc item you dropped will be returned back to your inventory)

Move the marker to where you want (Read section further down or check the SBS MCM menu to understand what keys are used to move it)

When you have the marker where you want press your Activate key.
The marker will disappear and the shelf will now be ready to be used just like any other book shelf.[/spoiler]
[color=#ff7700][size=4][u]Keys and Movement:[/u][/size][/color]
There are only 3 configurable keys, the rest of the keys are based on your native in game keys.
At anytime you can look in the SBS MCM menu to see what keys are and do.
While you have a Book Shelf selected you will be snapped to first person view and won't be able to draw weapons/spells, access inventory/map or activate objects until you Unselect the book shelf.
You can still freely move about (eg: sprint, jump, sneak) and access the System/MCM menu while a book shelf is selected.
To make it so you can use most of your native game keys I have used Left Attack/Block and Right Attack/Block as modifier keys.
While a book shelf is selected and your holding a modifier key you can use your movement keys to move the book shelf.
While holding either of the modifier keys it will stop you from moving so you can move the selected book shelf.
This method saves you having to dance your fingers all over the keyboard as the keys are all your native keys you normally use in the game to move.
It also saves wrestling with key conflicts as your not having to map every movement key.

[color=#ff7700][u][size=4]Configurable Keys:[/size][/u][/color]
[H] = Select a targeted Spawnable Book Shelf activator to move, duplicate or delete a spawned book shelf.
[Delete] = Delete the selected Spawnable Book Shelf (any items the book shelf has will be returned to you before deleting).
[Y] = Duplicate the Selected Book Shelf on the spot (does not duplicate the itemss that the shelf may have stored).

[color=#ff7700][size=4][u]Keys when a Spawnable Book Shelf is Selected[/u][/size][/color]
Keys to move Book Shelf Forward, Back, Left or Right:[Spoiler]While holding [Left Attack/Block] use your movement keys (WASD or what ever you have them set as).
[Forward] = Move Book Shelf Forward
[Back] = Move Book Shelf Backwards
[Left] = Move Book Shelf Left
[Right] = Move Book Shelf Right
[Ready/Holster Weapon] = Reset Book Shelf position in front of you (this does not reset rotation or height).[/spoiler]
Keys to move Book Shelf Up, Down or Rotation:[Spoiler]While holding [Right Attack/Block] use your [Movement] keys (WASD or what ever you have them set as).
[Forward] = Move Book Shelf Upwards
[Back] = Move Book Shelf Downwards
[Left] = Rotate Book Shelf Anti-Clockwise
[Right] = Rotate Book Shelf Clockwise
[Sprint] = Snap Rotate Book Shelf (mcm settings let you configure the snap degree and direction)
[Ready/Holster Weapon] = Reset Book Shelf Height (Tap key) Or Reset Rotation (Hold key)[/spoiler]
Other SBS Keys (while not holding modifier key):[spoiler][Activate] = Unselect Selected Book Shelf
[Delete] = Delete Selected Book Shelf
[Y] = Duplicate Selected Book Shelf on the spot (does not duplicate the itemss that the shelf may have stored).
[Shout] = Move Book Shelf to where your looking
[Run] = Toggle Book Shelf movement speed 2 (slow and accurate), 50 (medium and less accurate), 150 (fast and no accuracy).[/spoiler]
[color=#ff7700][size=4][u]Tip:[/u][/size][/color]
Read the SBS MCM menu tips when pointing at controls for brief info on what's what.

[color=#ff7700][size=4][u]Annoyances:[/u][/size][/color]
Books never seem to stand up straight, just like the vanilla Skyrim counter parts.
(I can change that, but at the expense of a more bloated and slower shelf script eg: Loop that calls multiple functions per book per iteration, no thanks).
Scrolls can stack in a mess, depends on the scrolls you store, but meh.

[color=#ff7700][size=4][u]General:[/u][/size][/color]
Expect bugs as I have not tested this for long periods of time as of yet.

[color=#ff7700][size=4][u]Permissions:[/u][/size][/color]
You may do as you please with this release, no need to ask or give credit.
Source scripts and models are in the BSA.

[color=#ff7700][size=4][u]Credits:[/u][/size][/color]
SKSE Team.
SkyUI Team.
author: sLoPpYdOtBiGhOlE
